name: Category Manager
description:
The responsibility of this role is to develop & execute business strategy to achieve GMV, target brand-portfolio, and SPU richness for assigned category – baby food. Category manager acts as e-shop director within AliExpress with full scope of responsibilities for the final outcome and full category performance.

Main Responsibilities:
Market analysis

  • Category analysis - market volume and its dynamics by segments; brands landscape (top ranked and new rising stars) with their value and price propositions, financial KPIs; key customer segments, insights and trends; key trends in the industry;
  • Be the category expert and consultant for the sellers to advice and help (KA – direct communications, others – conferences and webinars);
  • Create brand development list for local BD team.

Strategy

  • Create strategy (direction) and business plans (steps) and implement them in coherent manner. Constantly develop and analyze new business opportunities.

Assortment

  • Guarantee attractive products and competitive price in regular sales periods and for all promotion in alignment with company pricing and promo policy;
  • Manage and develop brand portfolio in accordance with the strategy and market analysis;
  • Analyze of the sellers, brands and product performance to get useful insight for category performance improvement.

Customer experience

  • Improving customer journey by development of category tree, increasing number of entering points to the category, improving on platform search results…;
  • Drive growth within customers in categories by understanding the shopping path, how marketplace engages with consumers and how brands and stores appear online.

Promotion

  • Brief and follow the marketing plan (ATL and BTL communications, landing pages, internal promotions, tune search and recommendation engines);
  • Work closely with all cross-functional teams such as Promo, Marketing, PR, Global Category management teams to ensure implementation of the marketing plan.

Local Key Sellers support

  • Build win-win and trustful relationships with KA brands, care about partners' and company's performance and profit;
  • Regular communications with KA on monthly basis (from onboarding stage) with result analysis, highlighting key achievements and creating joint action plan for improvements;
  • Negotiations with partners regarding different commercial conditions like pricing on the platform, conditions for delivery, width & breadth of the assortment;
  • Review KA sellers’ performance and profitability scorecard based.

Key requirements:

  • Master’s degree, preferably in marketing/business/economics;
  • 3+ years in baby food industry, experience in Non-standard industries category management (B2C), online sales, trade marketing and well connected with brands and suppliers;
  • Data Analysis – find out problems and their reasons or opportunities through data search, analysis, forecasting and other methods;
  • Project management - skills, and according to the goals flexibly adjusts the action plan during the process to ensure that projects meets the goals;
  • Strong business acumen and KPIs understanding in retail and e-commerce;
  • Advanced user of MS Excel;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English & Russian;
  • Target-oriented not process-oriented (driven by company vision, mission, targets; takes active actions to overcome difficulties and challenges to archive the expected result);
  • Excellent negotiation, sales and communication skills including presentation, facilitation and influencing;
  • Ability to work independently and within a high performing team;
  • Ability to multitask and complete tasks in a timely manner.

What we offer:

  • Work for one of world's biggest e-comm companies in Russia;
  • Comfortable office in Moscow City with limitless fruits and coffee;
  • Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses;
  • Mac or Windows laptop of your choice;
  • Corporate medical insurance.
